definition: to satisfy a craving/to get a kick out of sth/gratifying/immensely enjoyable/satisfying/fulfilling
to get into a habit/to become addicted
erhua variant of 癮頭|瘾头[yin3 tou2]

sentences.english: Is the intent from the unconscious addiction and desire to escape the pain?
sentences.chinese: 意想是來自於無意識癮性並渴望去逃避痛苦的嗎？

sentences.english: That's how it triggers addiction in one part of the brain.
sentences.chinese: 這就是它在大腦中部分地方促發成癮的原因。

sentences.english: By some freak I was overpaid this month.
Picking up the fresh strawberries was our happy time. We were orchardists.
sentences.chinese: 採摘新鮮草莓讓小朋友們過足了一把果農癮。

sentences.english: In fact, some scientists even see love as a sort of addiction.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，有些科學家甚至把愛情看作一種“癮”。

sentences.english: So many of us are addicted to the pulse.
sentences.chinese: 我們很多人都有脈動癮。

sentences.english: Internet video junkies will be happy to know that Mux is totally free of charge.
sentences.chinese: 網際網路視訊癮會樂於知道多工器是完全免費的。

sentences.english: Also many like to call it an “addiction”.
sentences.chinese: 同時很多人會把它看做是一種“癮”。

sentences.english: The environmental impact is only one cost of our oil addiction.
sentences.chinese: 環境污染只是我們石油癮的代價之一。

sentences.english: Researchers recruited 39 students who are self-professed snack food junkies.
sentences.chinese: 研究員招募了39個自稱愛零食愛上了癮的學生。

sentences.english: Its state-run media thundered that America needed to its addiction to debt.
sentences.chinese: 其央媒大肆宣揚說美國需要控制下其負債的癮。

sentences.english: Eventually I broke the addiction to credit cards, instead relying on loans from family members.
sentences.chinese: 最終我戒掉了用信用卡的癮，改成向家人“貸款”。

sentences.english: It's also the reason why many people love eating spicy hot pot, especially in winter.
sentences.chinese: 許多人從此失足，對麻辣火鍋喫上了癮。

definition: to get into a habit/to become addicted
to satisfy a craving/to get a kick out of sth/gratifying/immensely enjoyable/satisfying/fulfilling
to choke (because of swallowing the wrong way)
to irritate the nose/to choke (of smoke, smell etc)/pungent/(coll.) (Tw) to shout at sb/to scold/to speak out against sb
to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
confused/dizzy/giddy/to faint/to swoon/to lose consciousness/to pass out
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
to be infatuated with/to be enchanted by/to be passionate about
still/still in progress/still more/yet/even more/in addition/fairly/passably (good)/as early as/even/also/else
to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
want to stop but can't (idiom)/to be unable to stop oneself/to feel an urge to continue
to support/to prop up/to push or move with a pole/to maintain/to open or unfurl/to fill to bursting point/brace/stay/support
